title: Salesperson Evaluation
subtitle: Evaluate salesperson performance during client meetings
coreProducts: Identified core products the client uses (in their menu) but does not buy from METRO
prep1_1: No preparation, no idea what client uses
prep1_3: Knows several products, but not fully accurate
prep1_4: Clear list of key products missing from METRO orders
establishmentType: Determined type of establishment (restaurant/hotel) and cuisine style
prep2_1: No info about the client type
prep2_3: Knows type and some details about cuisine
focusProducts: Selected 1–2 focus products for the meeting
prep3_2: Mentioned a product but without strategy
prep3_3: Selected products but weak alignment with client needs
prep3_4: Clear choice of 1–2 products relevant for client + METRO goals
currentSupplier: Knows where the client currently orders from and why
prep4_4: Knows supplier + exact reasons for choice (price, delivery, quality)
priceAnalysis: Analyzed client's restaurant prices and quality/price preferences
prep5_1: No check on prices or preferences
prep5_4: Clear knowledge of price level + client's price/quality balance
productStrategy: Prepared strategy for focus product (e.g. which mozzarella, which brand)
prep6_3: Selected product but not fully justified
prep6_4: Clear strategy: specific product + aligned with client consumption and METRO targets
metroModel: Visit aligned with METRO contact model
prep7_2: Partially aligned, weak link to model
prep7_4: Fully aligned with contact model and segmentation strategy
askedClientExperience: Asked about client's experience with current supplier
priceQualityDelivery: Checked for issues with price, quality, and delivery
businessImpact: Clarified how issues affect client's business
prob3_4: Clear impact shown (e.g. menu planning, daily operations)
missingProduct: Explored problem with a core product METRO does not supply
prob4_4: Actively explored missing product as opportunity
listenedFully: Listened fully to objection without interrupting
marketContext: Put objection in market context & showed METRO's response
presentedSolution: Presented product as solution to specific problem
